I finally get to play!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): I finally get to play!
By torey_luvullo on Friday, August 11, 2000 - 06:01 am:

after a week of posting, i was able to turn my attention to the actual game for a couple of hours last night. here are some random observations:

1) ive tried a few different teams, but so far im most comfortable with, and have the best shot of winning with, my original team of pixie, naga, and golem. i've spent some time redoing the deck, but not the teams yet. of course i havent won that many monster cards either.

2) Damn isabella! i wanted that mew!

3) played in my first championship cup. our team[the flying pigs] got to the finals, but were routed there by stolatos and the boys. i did beat nelson en route tho. i saw what he was doing early on, and was lucky enough to have the cards to create a defended pixie to chip away at him.

4) stolatos[sp?] is another story - something like nelson but stronger. still, i had him down to a plant which had used his defense, and i had a grand end card to use, but my last cards were not attack cards, so i never got to use that strategy - the game ended with me having a grand end, and four def cards, and nothing left in my stacked deck.

5) i cant see me playing this game as long as i have played mr2, but it is a LOT better than i thought it was going to be. looks like i'll have some time to play this weekend, so i will report further whenever i feel like it!

By torey_luvullo on Saturday, August 12, 2000 - 06:08 pm:

ok - here's the update. i am in july 1001. have 12 monster cards. latest official tournament won is b level ghost, beat zita.

my strongest team is now a worm/hare/tiger combo. i keep a lot of def, spe, and env cards. the cards dictate my strategy, but about half the time i keep hare and tiger alive long enough to chip away at the other side[sometimes hare does a little more, cards permitting^_^] then worm ends up the survivor with a couple sidesteps and a lotta guts. from that point on, i either go into a nelson-like shell, or store guts for worm's boffo pow attacks.

not so much looking for advice[although it is gladly and gratefully accepted] as a peek into the future. i am obviously at the point where i am going to take on more and more powerful players as the game gets more and more difficult. where is this team going to go wrong? what weaknesses are the top ten going to exploit?

By Tony on Sunday, August 13, 2000 - 04:45 am:

Where you're going to run into trouble "in your Nelson-like shell" maybe when you start storing GUTS having them withered away if you don't have the right DEF card. I found that the best way to avoid getting the "environment" changed, is to have a Pray card. That's the only card that blocks environments cards, and can keep things in your favor. I can tell you this, as a bit of a hint: Stolatos has 2 or 3 Confusion cards in his deck. If you have Pray, you can beat him in simple card conservation. If you can, take out his plant, because it will load you up w/ Toxic Nectar. Antagonize it w/low cost GUTS moves until you take it out. Good Luck!!!

By Trickster on Monday, August 14, 2000 - 09:13 am:

Hey torey, one other thing to watch out for that I meant to mention - don't get to comfortable beating some of the decks of some of the tougher players, because when they go to a high level tournament, their decks might change. Alfonse comes to mind immediately, and so does Sephore. *shudder* Both their decks are a lot tougher in the A-class tournaments then if you challenge them out of the tourneys.

And yeah, you do eventually get the Mew from Isabella. I *think* one more fight will do it, but not positive. Plant and Zilla... hrm... .I forget where you get those. Although you can always go to the tournaments to get the specific monsters. :)

And as for the rankings, those are done by points, not by number of fights won/KO's. Plus, the points just seem to be won/lost in tournaments, so even if you have a lot of fights won outside of tournaments, that's not going to help your rank. It *seems* to just be your performance in the battles that counts. And if you lose in a lower class tournament than you should really be in (or maybe it's just the ranking of the people you're fighting, not sure), then you're going to lose more points than otherwise, and win less when you win the fights.

By Trickster on Tuesday, August 15, 2000 - 06:07 pm:

Tony: Hrm... a Speed Demon type deck and a Zilla/Worm/Golem deck... now where have I seen that before...? ;)

And as to the questions:

1) Yes, I think Tony is right.. you need to have all the other monsters to have a chance to win the Phoenix card, then you just need to win your matches. Apparently, while Pabs knows monster breeding, he just stinks at battle cards.

Don't feel bad though... after a while, you'll probably end up with more Phoenix cards than you know what to do with. *sigh*

2) *grins* because it wouldn't be nearly as aggravating otherwise! (And yes, this has started happening to me with mixed-breed monsters as well.. *sigh*)

3) Yup, again Tony is right, when you get "zapped away" I think that's at least one ending of the game (at least, the credits roll)... but then, after the credits are over, you get put back in your farm one month later with all your cards, etc., and can pick up where you left off.

4) As far as I know, you also can't get any mixed-breed monsters until after you've won the Championship Cup once. Then you can start getting them from tournaments, and I've also seen a few people give them to you after practice matches (!)

And as for the A class tournaments... you usually get 2 mixed-breed monsters if you win first place, but sometimes one will be a pure-breed monster again. Just what I need.

Man, I *really* wish there were a way to trade some monsters.

By Trickster on Thursday, August 17, 2000 - 06:08 pm:

Actually, I have far less trouble with Rascal than with most anyone else, mostly because we have the same type of deck (no dodge, all offense), 'cept mine seems to be a bit better. ;)

As to Stolatos, well, personally I'd try to outlast him. If you're going for a KO tho, (or even sometimes if not), there are a few key points...

Go for his plant first. He has very little in the way of dodge/defense for that thing, and it's what whittles your GUTS down. So you want to get rid of it as soon as possible. After that, you might want to try Close Up to try to keep the dodge cards out of his hand. 'Til he gets Confusion out. Or try the undodgables, or just try to keep whittling away again and again and try to basically out-attack his dodges.

There are also a few cards you might want to include in your deck for the fight against him:

More than one Environment card. So that if he keeps "trumping" yours with Confusion, you can then turn things around on him. Hopefully. If you draw it.

"Pray." Only if you don't use "Close-Up," obviously, because you need to have this in your hand. It keeps someone from playing an Environment card.

"Busy Time." This allows you to set your "cash in" your GUTS that you have, and put an equal number of cards equal to your GUTS score from your discards into your stacked cards, setting your GUTS to 0.

"Good luck." This allows you to "kill off" one of your monsters, and get a number of GUTS equal to the life force that it had left. Useful for if that darn plant of his withers away your GUTS, or if he's been dodging you so much that you're about out of GUTS. it's also very useful with "Busy Time." ;)

Oh yes, and if you do decide to try to outlast him, keep in mind that if you attack him, then he'll either have to dodge (and use up a card, making him use another from his stacked cards next draw phase) or take the hit. If you're doing this to outlast him, I'd suggest that the attack card you use is the only card you use that phase, and you don't convert any to GUTS. ;) Not that you really need to... he doesn't attack much, other than with his plant, so if it's KO'ed you don't really need to keep GUTS around for dodging/defending.

Hope some of that at least is helpful!

By Kurasu Soratobu on Thursday, August 24, 2000 - 09:40 am:

Well, I haven't had much time to do more than pick at the game a little bit... mostly because the SO has completely claimed it as his own! Ah well, at least I know I've got the edge in MR2 and get to keep it. ^_-

Anyhow, he runs mainly with two decks: one known as 'Juggernaut' and one known as 'Fastest' (obviously the upgrade of 'fast' and 'faster'.) Most of his others were for playing around, though they're pertty successful as well. However, if we're sharing monster recipes, here's Thomas' recipes. Make good use of 'em! They're both _quite_ successful.

Fastest (28W-2L)

Monsters: Pixie, Tiger, Mocchi

Mocchi: Slapx3, Roll Attackx1, Thrustx3, Headbuttx3, Lickingx2, Petal Windx1 (though he's planning on more to replace Licking), Rollx3

Tiger: Left Clawx3, Hornx2 (no right claw at all, poor boy!), Chargex1, Ice Bombx3, Boltx3, Roarx1, Back Rollx3

Pixie: Scratchx3, Kickx3, Thunmderx3, Boltx3, Enchantx1, Stepx3

Breeder: Hot Battlex1, Lock Tightx1

Needless to say, a 'Nice Fight' puts this out of commission pretty easily, unless he can get out his environment cards.
--------
Juggernaut: 28W-1L

Monsters: Golem, Dragon, Zilla (gee! Wonder where it got the name!)

Golem: Brow Hitx1, Kickx3, Throw Awayx3, Chopx1, W-Chopx2, Rollerx1, Cyclonex3

Zilla: Scratchx1, Belly Attackx2, Tail Lashesx1, Body Pressx2, Roll Assultx3, Bubblesx2, Tidal Wavex2

Dragon: Tail Attackx2, Spinning Clawx2, Dragon Punchx3, Dragon Combox3, Fore Breathx3

Any Monster: P.O.x3

Breeder: Nice Fightx1, Busy Timex2, Bad Weatherx1, Arid Landx1, Close Upx1

The exact opposite of the 'Faster' team, this one's made for... well, you can pretty clearly see what it's made for. Strips through cards like a dynamo, but tends to make a big mess out of things while doing it. Plus, the environment cards actually make it successful against the 'usual' weaknesses of the 'Wall' (Blue Wolves) decks and the 'Fast' decks.
